snippet: The nonprofit theater Ars Nova and the commercial producers of “Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812” are battling over the billing of the show....
abstract: Dispute over Playbill wording causes rift between small nonprofit theater company Ars Nova, which commissioned and developed musical Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812, and producers of $14 million version of show set to open on Broadway.
lead_paragraph: The nonprofit theater Ars Nova and the commercial producers of “Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812” are battling over the billing of the show.

headline.main: Three Words Lead to a Battle Over ‘Great Comet’ on Broadway
headline.print_headline: Three Words Lead to a Battle Over ‘Great Comet’

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812 (Play)
